intro: Tylophora hybostemma, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which bloom in the summer months. Tylophora hybostemma is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. It is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
